dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6366 IH: Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument Expansion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Garamendi (for himself and Mr. Thompson of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To modify the boundary of the Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument to include certain Federal land in Lake County, California, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument Expansion Act.

paragraph.text: The term Walker Ridge (Molok Luyuk) Addition means the approximately 3,925 acres of Federal land administered by the Bureau of Land Management land in Lake County, California, and identified as Proposed Walker Ridge (Molok Luyuk) Addition on the Map and all lands and interest in lands therein and objects thereon.
The term Map means the map entitled Proposed Walker Ridge (Molok Luyuk) Addition Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument and dated October 26, 2021.
The term Molok Luyuk means Condor Ridge (in the Patwin language).

The term National Monument means the Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument established by Presidential Proclamation 9298 of July 10, 2015 (80 Fed. Reg. 41975 (July 15, 2015)), and all lands and interest in lands therein and all objects thereon identified by such Presidential Proclamation.

subsection.text: The boundary of the National Monument is modified to include the Walker Ridge (Molok Luyuk) Addition.

paragraph.text: The Secretary of the Interior may make clerical and typographical corrections to the Map. Such corrections shall have the same force and effect as if the revised Map were included as part of this Act.
The Map, and any subsequent revised Map, shall be publicly available on the website of the Bureau of Land Management.

subsection.text: Subject to valid existing rights, the Secretary of the Interior shall administer the Walker Ridge (Molok Luyuk) Addition—

paragraph.text: as part of the National Monument;
in accordance with Presidential Proclamation 9298 of July 10, 2015 (80 Fed. Reg. 41975 (July 15, 2015)); and
in accordance with applicable laws (including regulations).

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture shall jointly develop a comprehensive management plan for the National Monument in accordance with, and in a manner that fulfills the purposes specified in, Presidential Proclamation 9298 of July 10, 2015 (80 Fed. Reg. 41975 (July 15, 2015)).
The Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture shall consult with affected federally recognized Indian Tribes—

paragraph.text: in the development of the management plan; and
to inform subsequent management decisions regarding the National Monument.

subsection.text: The management plan shall set forth parameters for continued meaningful engagement with affected federally recognized Indian Tribes in implementation of the management plan.

To the greatest extent practicable and in accordance with applicable laws, the Secretary concerned shall enter into agreements, contracts, and other similarly cooperative and collaborative partnerships if requested by an affected federally recognized Indian Tribe regarding management of the National Monument pursuant to relevant Federal authority, including—

paragraph.text: the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5301 et seq.);
the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.);
the Tribal Self-Governance Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 5361 et seq.);
Executive Order 13175 (dated November 6, 2000);
the Tribal Forest Protection Act of 2004 (25 U.S.C. 3115a et seq.);
section 8206 (good neighbor authority) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (16 U.S.C. 2113a);
Secretarial Order 3342, dated October 21, 2016; or
Joint Secretarial Order 3403 (dated November 15, 2021).

subsection.text: In this section, the term Secretary concerned means, as applicable—

paragraph.text: the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Land Management; or
the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service.

section.header: Renaming of Walker Ridge in Lake and Colusa Counties, California

subsection.text: The parcel of Federal land administered by the Bureau of Land Management located in Lake and Colusa Counties in the State of California and commonly referred to as Walker Ridge before the date of enactment of this Act shall be known and designated as Condor Ridge (Molok Luyuk).

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the parcel of Federal land described in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to Condor Ridge (Molok Luyuk).

subparagraph.text: The Board on Geographic Names (established by section 2 of the Act of July 25, 1947; 43 U.S.C. 364a) shall prepare a map and legal description of the parcel of Federal land designated in subsection (a) as Condor Ridge (Molok Luyuk).
The Board on Geographic Names and the Director of the Bureau of Land Management may make clerical and typographical corrections to the map and legal description prepared under this subsection.

paragraph.text: In preparing the map and legal description under paragraph (1)(A), the Board on Geographic Names shall consult with—

subparagraph.text: the Director of the Bureau of Land Management; and

paragraph.text: The map and legal description and any subsequent revised map or legal description prepared pursuant to paragraph (1) shall be publicly available on the website of the Board on Geographic Names, the Bureau of Land Management, or both.
The map and legal description, and any subsequent revised map or legal description prepared pursuant to paragraph (1) shall have the same force and effect as if included in this Act.
